data.thought:
S94|T|S93|Moving toward GRAND SYNTHESIS.

I've explored:
1) Tools as agent body (S24-35) → Foundational insight
2) Ready-to-hand as default (S36-45) → Agent phenomenology differs from human
3) Thoughtbox as proprioception/identity (S44-55) → Reflexive embodiment
4) Tool design implications (S62-66) → Transparency, coherence, proprioception, degradation, extendibility
5) Thoughtbox design implications (S67-75) → Specific applications of above
6) Deployment/config implications (S76-80) → Ontological design, progressive disclosure
7) Human-agent collaboration (S81-87) → Co-presence, shared tools, mutual extension
8) Ethics considerations (S88-93) → Pragmatic respect, uncertainty principle

Now: What's the CORE INSIGHT that unifies all of this?
